intro: Stichorkis hawchengii, commonly known as the Hawcheng's stichorkis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in China. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and somewhat woody. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
